Slogan: The Major dedicated to information systems and software engineering
AboutText: Nowadays, companies have to develop Information Systems and complex softwares which core features are their ability to evolve, their reliability as well as their performance. Companies requirements are evolving even faster with the apparition of new market actors and disruptive business models backed up by the promise of new technologies, even more connected and cheaper than ever. There is a need for faster technologies in order to transform existing systems and create the new business services for both today and tomorrow : Online Presence, Interconnection with all Information Systems, new real-time services, better understanding of client needs.
ModulesIntro: In order to better prepare our students for the business community, SIGL specialty is focused on 4 major topics, every one of which bringing a part of the skills and culture required in order to build tomorrow's technologies
M&AText: Discover and grasp the new software challenges in order to integrate it in growing mobility requirements
C&AText: Understanding the building and functioning process of Information Systems as well as its technical architecture. Discovering Cloud technologies and Big Data
L&MText: Handling the new business models in order to answer the IT governance's new challenges and train tomorrow's managers
D&TText: Understanding and make Digital Transformation viable for companies as well as discovering the new innovation levers provided by the growing sector of IT business
ARCLText: Creation of an hybrid cloud using Openstack technologies as well as PaaS Services such as AWS or Microsoft Azure
VIRTText: Business case realization based on cost lines and saving levers, study of a genuine company inventory.
IOTText: Creation of an IoT Object and build marketing & business processes (Business Case, Advertising) as well as the realization
PAEText: Group Project in partnership with several companies : Professional Relationships of EPITA, Korn Ferry
URSIText: Creation of a reduced Information System simulating a Retail company's behavior
WTText: Web project realization, each developped with choice-based modern web technology : ROR, Javascript, Golang...
PMSText: SIGL, Security and Network students work together to propose a transformation solution in a real context
MEPAText: Apply SCRUM's best practices in a free choice group project
ARCHText: Class Project in order to get an overview of all possible aspects of IS Architecture
LM_OPDI: OPDI : Information Systems Steering and Organization
LM_OPCO_text1: Being able to manage time, and efficiently apply a personal organization
LM_OPCO_text2: Being able to reinforce professional efficiency using a better communication
LM_OPCO_text3: Being able to manage its own professional project
LM_AMOA_text1: Apprehend and understand Information System from a company's Point of view
LM_AMOA_text2: Identify roles, missions and positioning of Project Management
LM_AMOA_text3: Define responsibilities between Project Management's business units
LM_AMOA_text4: Being Able to conduct an organizational study for IT products / services
LM_OPDI_text1: Understand digital impact on Information Systems
LM_OPDI_text4: Evaluate IT Projects' Return on Investment
LM_OPDI_text5: Understand IT System Department Cost Reduction Levers
LM_COIN_text3: Understand the key concepts of communication and teamwork
LM_CECI_text2: Set of methodologies to help better understand the different aspects of communication
LM_URSI_text1: Discover Information Systems reality in a company
LM_URSI_text2: Understand Middleware base that supports it
LM_URSI_text3: Understanding Integration issues within the Information System
LM_URSI_text4: Grasp the concept of innovation within the IS
LM_ARCL_text1: Validate skills acquisition by building an hybrid cloud and a cloud-based application
LM_ARCL_text2: Understand key notions of Cloud Computing
LM_SOAR_text1: Understand and practice the implementation of a Solution Architecture
LM_CONT_text2: Discover the good practices of containers and their ecosystem
LM_CONT_text3: Know how to use and integrate containers in a continuous integration and deployment chain
LM_DATA_text1: Understand the typologies of data, current uses and new uses
LM_DATA_text4: Organization of the company around the data
LM_ARLA_text1: Acquire key concepts and principles of Software Architecture
LM_ARLA_text2: To put the architecture and the architect into the organization
LM_ARLA_text3: Know how to analyze the relevance of software technologies for needs
LM_MEPA_text1: General concepts of development productivity's issues
LM_MEPA_text2: Experiment tools associated with Agile's planning and development methods
LM_MEPA_text3: Face issues such as repriorization and silver bullet
LM_ACOO_text3: Learn key concepts of UML and Object-oriented development
LM_NLPF_text1: Have a culture of new languages and frameworks
LM_NLPF_text3: Carry out a comparison and analysis process
LM_DEVO_text1: Understand DevOps added value against classical development methods
LM_DEVO_text2: Understand the DevOps transformation within a project
LM_DSO_text1: Understand the concepts and areas of security within an information system
LM_DSO_text2: Define a safety approach in a plan project technical and organizational
LM_DSO_text3: Understand new security paradigms in cloud and container architectures
LM_ACCC_text1: Understad what's at stake during a transformation
LM_ACCC_text2: Learn key notions of Change Management
LM_INNO_text1: Use creative and innovative methods for problem solving
LM_PMDE_text1: Learn how to approach issues using dichotomy
LM_DIGI_text1: Through a case study of Art Market's digitalization, acquire key notions of how innovation and transformation are keys for business purposes
LM_DIGI_text2: Approach the matter on several angles, based on comparisons with the media industry
LM_DIGI_text3: Learn the main differences between innovation and transformation
LM_VIT2_text1: Discuss financial and technological models based on cloud computing
LM_VIT2_text2: Apprehend unsolicited actions with a client and elaborate a Business Case

LM_METH_text1: Learn and practice several development and project management methods
LM_METH_text2: Discover conceptual models and their applications in a business context
LM_PERS_text1: Undestand and control the evolution of the IT market.

GISTRE: CERES (Computing Engineering for Real-time and Embedded Systems)

ARCL_JOB: Head of Public Cloud Center of Excellence | Société Générale

PERS_JOB1: Director of the Hybrid IT Expertise Centre | HPE
Sub_event1:
Maintain and renew the link with former students, and allow future engineers to exchange with those who preceded them: it is with this in mind that the SIGL BBQ is organized each year, bringing together teachers,
former students and future graduates.
Sub_event2: Class representatives are taking the initiative to regulary organize some ecents within the major (cinema, laser game, etc.) in order to give students the opportunity to connect with each others beyond the professional environment.
Sub_event3: To establish a culture of team cohesion and in order to boost up the dialogue between teams, moments of exchange and relaxation bringing together teachers and students are organised
Sub_event4: In order to celebrate together the end of studies and the success of their year, a disintegration event is organized by the students at the end of their courses. Lastest destination is: Lisbon!
